intro: Osmitopsis asteriscoides, commonly known as the starflower or mountain starflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in harsh, sunny conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Osmitopsis asteriscoides plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of alpine ecosystems.
